events.title: Rubio braces for Senate scrutiny over Venezuela
events.summary: At his first Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing since Nicolas Maduro was seized, Secretary of State Marco Rubio warns the U.S. could still use force to pressure Venezuela's adminstration.

events.title: Trump admin rewrites nuclear safety rules. And, NTSB releases findings on D.C. crash
events.summary: NPR obtains documents showing the Trump administration secretly cut nuclear safety rules to fast-track new reactors. And, investigators blame systemic failures for a deadly midair crash near D.C.

events.title: Mexican president says her country has paused oil shipments to Cuba
events.summary: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said the pause was part of general fluctuations in oil supplies and that it was a "sovereign decision" not made under pressure from the United States.

events.title: Spain will grant legal status to immigrants lacking authorization
events.summary: Spain's government announced Tuesday it will grant legal status to potentially hundreds of thousands of immigrants living and working in the country without authorization.

events.title: Italian officials voice outrage at the presence of U.S. ICE agents at the 2026 Olympics
events.summary: U.S. Homeland Security agents provided security support at past Olympics. But after violence by ICE agents in Minneapolis, some Italian officials say an ICE unit is unwelcome in Milan Cortina.

events.title: EU signs 'mother of all deals' to boost trade with India
events.summary: The European Union has signed what India's prime minister has called "the mother of all deals" to boost trade with India. For Europe, the move seeks to hedge against its unpredictable ties to the U.S.

events.title: The Trader Joe's tote bag goes global
events.summary: Trader Joe's tote bags have become all the rage overseas. Why have the supermarket chain's bags become an international fashion statement?

events.title: Activists fear U.S. visa restrictions for Palestinians will hurt diplomacy
events.summary: Palestinians can no longer apply for a U.S. visa with documents issued by the Palestinian Authority — another sign, they say, that the Trump administration is sidelining Palestinians.

events.title: Ex-FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins those calling for boycott of World Cup in U.S.
events.summary: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Trump and his administration at home and abroad.

events.title: India and the EU clinch the 'mother of all deals' in a historic trade agreement
events.summary: India and the European Union have reached a free trade agreement, at a time when Washington targets them both with steep import tariffs, pushing major economies to seek alternate partnerships.

events.title: Germany updates: Bundestag marks Holocaust Remembrance Day
events.summary: Germany's parliament is marking Holocaust Remembrance Day in the presence of a survivor. Meanwhile, five people were injured after shots were fired during a police car chase on Tuesday night. DW has more.

events.title: Israel eyes opening Rafah crossing, Gaza's gate to Egypt
events.summary: After being closed since May 2024, the Rafah crossing will likely soon reopen, allowing people to move between Gaza and Egypt again. The prospect gives Palestinians hope, but Israel will continue to impose restrictions.

events.title: Environmental crises add to Iran's mounting troubles
events.summary: Widespread discontent in Iran has sent millions of protesters into the streets. Poor environmental planning embodies one of the government's most existential vulnerabilities.

events.title: Cameroon in shock after suspected separatist attack
events.summary: Eight children were killed in an attack on a remote village in Cameroon's North West has shocked the nation. But there appears no end in sight to the separatist conflict in the Anglophone regions.

events.title: EU's Kallas urges 'more European' NATO amid Trump rupture
events.summary: US President Donald Trump has made it clear he doesn't want to support Europe like previous administrations. Europe is now grappling with how best to maintain its own defenses.

events.title: How Germany's skilled worker gap exposes migration hurdles
events.summary: Germany is facing a massive shortage of skilled workers, from nurses to IT specialists. The country needs hundreds of thousands of professionals, but bureaucracy and political hurdles are slowing recruitment abroad.

events.title: What 'banana republic' means — and why its history matters
events.summary: From plantations to political rhetoric, the term's evolution shows how a violent past can fade into metaphor, sometimes obscuring its true history.

events.title: India: Deputy state leader among 5 killed in plane crash
events.summary: Ajit Pawar, the deputy chief minister of Maharashtra, was on board a private plane that crashed in western India. There were no survivors from the crash.

events.title: Iraq faces return of ex-PM linked to 'Islamic State' rise
events.summary: Ex-prime minister Nouri al-Maliki is often seen as responsible for sectarian tensions and military mismanagement that made the "Islamic State" possible in Iraq. He's just been nominated as Iraq's next prime minister.

events.title: South Korea's ex-first lady sentenced to prison for bribery
events.summary: A South Korean court has sentenced Kim Keon Hee, the wife of disgraced former President Yoon Suk Yeol, to 20 months in prison for corruption.

events.title: Rwanda takes UK to court over contentious migrant deal
events.summary: Rwanda accuses the UK of "intransigence" and says London owes it millions of pounds.

events.title: Zelenskyy condemns 'terrorism' after Russia hits train in Ukraine
events.summary: A drone struck a train carriage carrying nearly 200 passengers in Ukraine, in an attack authorities blamed on Russia.

events.title: TikTok settles amid looming social media addiction trial
events.summary: The social video platform is among the companies facing accusations that their platforms deliberately addict and harm children.

events.title: Netherlands set for minority coalition as parties reach deal
events.summary: Three Dutch political parties clinched a coalition deal but will have to rely on support from other parties to govern.

events.title: ICE on US streets challenges American norms, founding values
events.summary: The Trump administration has moved ICE's center of activity from the border with Mexico to the heart of US cities. Federal agents' encounters with the public are challenging the foundational ideas of the United States.

events.title: How does Germany deport people?
events.summary: Germany does not have masked ICE officers or an equivalent agency, but both Chancellor Friedrich Merz and his predecessor have done all they can to accelerate deportations. Here's how the process works.

events.title: Minnesota: Trump wants 'honorable' probe into Pretti killing
events.summary: Facing nationwide backlash, Donald Trump described the killing of Alex Pretti by federal agents in Minneapolis as "very sad." Meanwhile, a planned visit by ICE members has stirred controversy in Italy. DW has more.

events.title: Iran: Victim numbers rise as US announces military drills
events.summary: A US-based group said the number of people killed in the protests against the regime in Iran has exceeded 6,100. US war ships have reached the region, with an IRCG official warning neighbors against aiding any strikes.

events.title: Nipah virus: India says only 2 cases confirmed as fears rise
events.summary: India's government said there were two confirmed cases of Nipah virus since December last year, with all those in contact with the affected people having been quarantined and tested.

events.title: ICE agents spark controversy in Italy over Olympics plans
events.summary: A group of American ICE agents is set to travel to Italy and provide additional security to the US delegation during the Winter Olympics. "It's not like the SS are coming," Italy's Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani said.

events.title: Dutch court sentences Eritrean migrant smuggler to 20 years
events.summary: A Dutch court on Tuesday sentenced Eritrean Amanuel W. to 20 years in prison in the Netherlands' largest migrant smuggling case so far. More suspects are set to appear in court later this year.

events.title: FIFA ex-President Blatter backs call to boycott World Cup
events.summary: With the US due to co-host the football World Cup this summer, former FIFA President Sepp Blatter said a former colleague was "right" to advise supporters to "stay home" and watch on TV amid an immigration crackdown.

events.title: Germany's Green Party under pressure over Mercosur vote
events.summary: The Greens are big supporters of international agreements. But, now, eight German lawmakers in the European Parliament have all but scuppered the Mercosur free trade agreement — defying their party's leadership.

events.title: Protests in Iran: Ali Karimi leads sports' call for support
events.summary: Former Iran and Bayern Munich footballer Ali Karimi has signed an open letter, asking FIFA to act. He is not the only athlete to be vocal.

events.title: Plastic emissions could double health damage by 2040
events.summary: Plastic pollution could double its harm to human health in the coming decades if current production trends continue, according to a new study that links rising risks directly to the manufacture of new plastics.

events.title: IOC rejects extra Winter Olympics spot for skeleton's Uhlaender
events.summary: IOC President Kirsty Coventry had been asked to intervene after Katie Uhlaender was the victim of alleged competition manipulation, causing her to miss out on February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: German FA boss says World Cup boycott would be 'misguided'
events.summary: At the first DFL meeting of 2026, German FA boss Bernd Neuendorf spoke for the first time about a World Cup boycott.

events.title: Holocaust Remembrance Day: Europe remembers Nazi genocide
events.summary: Auschwitz survivor Tatiana Bucci has addressed MEPs in a special session. An event will be held at the Auschwitz-Birkenau memorial in Poland to commemorate the concentration camp's liberation 81 years ago.

events.title: Holocaust survivor Leon Weintraub: "We were dehumanized"
events.summary: The 100-year-old vividly recalls the hunger, death camps and cruelty of the guards. Thus, he tirelessly works to ensure that the Holocaust is never forgotten.

events.title: Paris Agreement 10 years on: More wins than you may realize
events.summary: Major emitter the US has officially left the Paris Agreement and global emissions keep rising a decade on from the deal. Yet renewables' growth shows climate action can work. Here's what's been done and what's missing.

events.title: Australian Open tennis encounters extreme heat
events.summary: Tournament organizers have instituted their extreme heat protocols amid blistering temperatures in the region.

events.title: France's lawmakers vote to ban social media for under-15s
events.summary: As social media usage has grown, it has heightened concerns about excessive screen time and its negative impact on child development and mental health.

events.title: EU, India clinch historic free trade deal
events.summary: The deal between Brussels and New Delhi aims to forge a market of 2 billion people and nearly a quarter of global GDP, according to the European Commission.

events.title: Ye aka Kanye West apologizes for antisemitic remarks
events.summary: The artist previously known as Kanye West blamed his behavior on bipolar disorder, saying he "lost touch with reality."

events.title: Berlin's young Jews reveal complex experiences with antisemitism
events.summary: Jewish people in Berlin have had varying experiences since October 7, 2023, but several DW spoke to say they have seen more antisemitism and have become increasingly cautious.

events.title: Germany, France, others rebuke Trump's NATO troop disrespect
events.summary: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said it would show "decency" for Donald Trump to apologize for comments on NATO troops in Afghanistan. "But we all know how the US president operates," Pistorius added.

events.title: Latin America waiting: What's next for the EU-Mercosur deal?
events.summary: The European Commission eyes pushing the bloc’s biggest ever trade deal ahead without the European Parliament’s okay ― for now.

events.title: Retrial in murder of Slovak journalist and fiancee begins
events.summary: The second retrial in the Jan Kuciak murder case began on January 26. Businessman Marian Kocner again faces charges after the Slovak Supreme Court overturned his previous two acquittals.

events.title: Gold breaks $5,000: What's fueling the price rally and where will it end?
events.summary: Gold continues to hit record highs, having already had a bumper run in 2025. Geopolitical and economic uncertainty are the key factors, while doubts over the US dollar are also attracting new investors.

events.title: UK: Suella Braverman defects from Conservatives to Reform
events.summary: The former UK Cabinet member is the latest high-ranking Conservative politician to defect to Reform UK, led by Nigel Farage. Another senior Tory, Robert Jenrick, was pushed before he could leave earlier this month.

events.title: EU opens probe into Musk's Grok chatbot
events.summary: The European Commission is to look into whether Elon Musk's Grok AI chatbot is spreading illegal content in the EU. Among other things, Grok has been used to make manipulated sexualized images, often of women and minors.

events.title: EU pushes for deals as Trump's tariffs upset global trade
events.summary: Fear over Trump's tariff walls and the aggressive tone coming from the White House is pushing the European Union to focus on getting other trade agreements done. Despite all efforts, the EU sometimes gets in its own way.

events.title: Germany: Business index starts year with 'little momentum'
events.summary: Germany's Ifo business barometer was stagnant in January, bucking predictions of a slight improvement. A dip in confidence in the service sector put the brakes on improved sentiments in other areas.

events.title: EU agrees on complete ban of Russian gas imports by 2027
events.summary: The European Union has taken another step toward ending its energy reliance on Russia by agreeing to stop gas imports from the country. But not all countries voted in favor of the ban.

events.title: Media freedom in the spotlight as Kuciak murder case reopens
events.summary: Europe presents itself as a defender of the free press, yet some high-profile murders of EU journalists have yet to be resolved. Will a new trial into the death of Slovak journalist Jan Kuciak change that?

events.title: Germany news: Bounty offered over Berlin power grid attack
events.summary: German authorities have offered a €1 million bounty for tips related to this month's massive Berlin blackout. Meanwhile, European leaders discussed energy and security cooperation in Hamburg. DW has more.

events.title: Calls grow for European teams to boycott World Cup 2026
events.summary: As with Russia in 2018 and Qatar in 2022, politics are dominating the buildup to North America's 2026 World Cup. Could discontent with Donald Trump in Europe see football heavyweights unite to boycott the tournament?

events.title: Russia looks to India to fill labor shortage
events.summary: Russia needs workers — and is now hiring in India. Why Moscow is shifting its migration strategy, and what awaits Indians arriving in Russia.

events.title: US–EU economic ties show why neither side can decouple
events.summary: Despite a pause in tariff escalation, US–EU trade remains volatile under Donald Trump. From deficits and energy to services and the dollar, the trans-Atlantic relationship reveals deep ties — and clear vulnerabilities.

events.title: Blood supplies running low in Germany
events.summary: A shortage of blood donations in Germany could have dramatic consequences. The situation was critical in mid-January. DW's Marcel Fürstenau answered a call to donate blood and reported on his experience.

events.title: In Greenland, US-NATO deal met with relief, mistrust
events.summary: A "framework" agreement between the US and NATO has defused the dispute over Greenland. There is cautious relief among residents, but also fear of once again becoming a geopolitical pawn.

events.title: Ukraine: Zelenskyy calls Abu Dhabi talks 'constructive'
events.summary: The Ukrainian president said the talks with Russia and the US could resume "as early as next week." Meanwhile, Russian missiles have hit Kyiv and Kharkiv, killing one person. DW has more.

events.title: Bulgarians quit Germany, choose remote work
events.summary: Many highly skilled Bulgarians are moving back to their home country, swayed by the major income boost for remote work.

events.title: Germany weighs boon and bane of China's industrial expansion
events.summary: From cheap exports to cutting-edge tech: A Chinese battery giant's secretive factory in Germany shows how "Made in China" and "Made in Germany" are colliding — and where they can benefit from each other.

events.title: Thousands of locals have left Kyiv amid blackouts
events.summary: Residents of the Ukrainian capital are facing massive power outages, a lack of water and heat as Russia intensifies attacks on the country's energy grid. As many as 600,000 may have left the city.

events.title: Merz says Germany won't join Trump's 'Board of Peace'
events.summary: German Chancellor Merz said the current form of US President Trump's "Board of Peace" prevented Germany from joining for "constitutional reasons." But Merz said he was open to "new formats" of cooperation with the US.

events.title: 'Sweet Caroline' singer Neil Diamond turns 85
events.summary: He was a pop icon in the 1970s. Today, one of his songs is experiencing a viral resurgence. From soccer stadiums to TikTok, Neil Diamond's "Sweet Caroline" hasn't stopped playing.

events.title: Will US-Russia-Ukraine talks bring war to an end?
events.summary: Ukraine, the US and Russia are set to hold their first-ever trilateral meeting to find ways to end the war.

events.title: Germany investigates Russian espionage case
events.summary: After identifying a suspected agent, Germany has expelled a Russian embassy employee and summoned the Russian ambassador.

events.title: Former Scorpions bassist, Francis Buchholz, dies aged 71
events.summary: The musician's family said he died following a battle with cancer. Buchholz played bass for the Scorpions rock band until 1992, during one of their most successful periods.

events.title: Rodman becomes new 'highest paid' women's footballer
events.summary: USA forward Trinity Rodman has re-signed with the Washington Spirit of the National Women's Soccer League in a deal that will reportedly pay her in excess of $2 million per season.

events.title: Trump, Zelenskyy, Carney dominate Davos 2026: As it happened
events.summary: The World Economic Forum has come to an end after a tense but ultimately anti-climactic week at Davos, with the US, Ukrainian and Canadian leaders attracting the most attention. Read DW's wrap of the summit.

events.title: EU to stay 'cordial' with US after Trump's Greenland threats
events.summary: Trump deciding to wind back on tariffs on countries opposed his takeover of Greenland reduced the pressure at a hastily arranged summit of EU leaders. But they used the meeting to prepare Europe for another barrage.

events.title: Germany: Nord Stream suspect cannot claim immunity
events.summary: German judges have nixed an appeal by a Ukrainian national suspected of helping blow up an underwater gas pipeline to be freed from prosecution. Neighboring Poland is refusing to extradite his alleged co-conspirator.

events.title: EU leaders seek to preserve ties with US
events.summary: EU wants to revive trade ties with the US, but warned the bloc will stand up for its interests. It also announced after an emergency summit that it will double its investment in Greenland.

events.title: Can China rely on domestic oil after Iran, Venezuela shocks?
events.summary: Donald Trump's moves against two key suppliers have revived debate over China’s fragile oil balance. With domestic output flat and oil fields aging, how much capacity — if any — exists to raise production?

events.title: Merz and Meloni reshape Germany-Italy relations
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz and Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni are showing closer ties than their countries have in years. Meloni is no longer seen as a right-wing outsider, taking on a role as mediator with Donald Trump.

events.title: Greenland 'ready to negotiate' better partnership, PM says
events.summary: Jens-Frederik Nielsen said sovereignty was a "red line" that needed to be respected as he said Greenland was ready to negotiate after Trump backtracked on suggesting force could be used to acquire it. Follow DW.

events.title: 'Sinners' breaks records at 2026 Oscar nominations
events.summary: The film by Ryan Coogler earned 16 nods for the 98th Academy Awards, which will be presented on March 15. A new Oscar category was also introduced for the first time in 25 years.

events.title: From Inuit to Vikings to Trump: The history of Greenland
events.summary: After being inhabited only by Indigenous peoples for centuries, the Arctic island saw the Vikings in the 10th century and the Danes in 1721, and it attracted US interest back in 1867.

events.title: Germany: Far-right extremist 'Saxon Separatists' stand trial
events.summary: The trial of 8 suspected right-wing extremists accused of planning a coup is beginning in the German city of Dresden. Their goal: A Nazi state.

events.title: Davos: Germany's Merz says old world order 'unraveling'
events.summary: German Chancellor Merz said the world has "entered an era of great power politics" where Russia and China challenge the US. In his speech at Davos, Merz said Europe must boost competitiveness and invest in defense.

events.title: UN backs boost in nature-saving business
events.summary: Global financing is heavily skewed to industries that harm rather than preserve nature, according to a new report that calls for an urgent scale-up of nature-positive spending.

events.title: Davos WEF: Trump touts policies, renews Greenland ambitions
events.summary: Donald Trump used his WEF speech to praise himself and lash out at Europe while offering little on the economy. Business and political leaders were expecting the worst, but much of it was for a domestic audience.

events.title: Germany's rail service dealt major blow by government
events.summary: The government is reportedly walking back promises to fund major projects for national train operator Deutsche Bahn. DB is beset by chronic punctuality problems, decrepit infrastructure and a lack of investment.

events.title: European Parliament votes to delay Mercosur deal in court
events.summary: Lawmakers voted narrowly to challenge the EU trade deal with Latin America in the bloc's top court, a move that could derail the deal. Chancellor Friedrich Merz said the deal should be provisionally enacted anyway.

events.title: Free solo climb on Netflix: 'If you fall, you're gonna die'
events.summary: Rock climber Alex Honnold plans to scale the facade of what was once the world's tallest building — live on Netflix. But not all are impressed by the idea.

events.title: Apple overtakes Samsung in phones sales worldwide
events.summary: After 14 years behind Samsung, Apple is back on top in global smartphone sales, just as Chinese rivals step up the pressure. Foldables and advanced AI are the new battleground in the fight for the next billion users.

events.title: Germany sees thousands join pro-Kurdish protests
events.summary: German cities saw large pro-Kurdish demonstrations on Tuesday as Syrian government troops clash with Kurdish forces in northeastern Syria.

events.title: WEF in Davos: Is Greenland the wake-up call Europe needed?
events.summary: Europe faces waning influence amid wars, trade tensions, climate inaction and a US administration quick to hurl insults at its oldest allies. In Davos, leaders discuss how Europe can regain its mojo.

events.title: Halabja Massacre: Survivors still haunted by chemical weapons strike
events.summary: Kurdish Iraqis who survived the 1988 chemical weapons attack on Halabja and nearby communities have lasting trauma, a new report finds, highlighting the need for long-term support.

events.title: How bringing back a humble algae to Arctic waters makes all the difference
events.summary: For decades, researchers in northern Norway had tried to bring back vital kelp forests after overfishing damaged marine ecosystems. Now a simple solution is proving successful.

events.title: Iran's economic woes expose regime's tight grip
events.summary: As religious elites and Revolutionary Guards strengthen their hold on the economy, experts question how long the regime can survive.

events.title: African fans fume at 'disgraceful' World Cup travel ban
events.summary: Senegal's football team are champions of Africa, but fans from the country are banned from going to the US for the World Cup. They aren't the only ones, with Donald Trump's hostility and FIFA ticket prices hitting hard.

events.title: Like potatoes? Berlin is giving away 4 million kilos
events.summary: As an initiative redistributes a bumper surplus of spuds, here's a look at the Germans' great love affair with the potato.

events.title: Germany-US rift is looming after a year of Trump
events.summary: The second term of US President Donald Trump has brought unprecedented strain on once-solid German-American relations. The issue of Greenland could be a tipping point. DW looks back on a year of trans-Atlantic tensions.

events.title: How can the EU respond to US 'blackmail' over Greenland?
events.summary: European leaders have three main options for responding to the Trump administration’s economic threats. If they don’t get it right, Trump may be emboldened to take over Greenland.

events.title: Meet Veronika, the clever cow with tools to scratch herself
events.summary: A cow in Austria has been observed using tools ― the first time such behavior has been recorded in cattle. Have we underestimated the gentle bovines all this time?

events.title: Why Germany probably won't get political at 2026 World Cup
events.summary: After their very public protest at the last World Cup in Qatar, Germany's football team looks unlikely to do the same in the United States in 2026.

events.title: 'Sentimental Value' sweeps European Film Awards. Next step, Oscars?
events.summary: Joachim Trier's drama won the top accolades, adding to the buzz ahead of the Oscar awards. Iran was also in the spotlight, with director Jafar Panahi decrying the government's brutal crackdown on protest.

events.title: WEF: Donald Trump set to dominate Davos 2026
events.summary: Weeks after attacking Venezuela, capturing its controversial leader, and reviving Greenland ambitions, the US president's presence in Davos is expected to raise the stakes at the WEF's annual meeting.

events.title: Germany news: Syrian president puts planned visit on hold
events.summary: President Ahmad al-Sharaa has postponed his visit to Berlin, for talks with Chancellor Friedrich Merz, due to the political situation in his country. The repatriation of Syrian refugees was high on the agenda.

events.title: 8 fun facts about Dolly Parton for her 80th birthday
events.summary: Dolly Parton is one of the world's most successful artists. Now 80, she has an eventful life to look back over. Here are some important and extraordinary facts about the country music icon.

events.title: Germany's most powerful state leader wants to redraw the map
events.summary: Bavaria's Markus Söder is calling for fewer German federal states, but plans to merge them have drawn criticism. How realistic is a change in political lines?

events.title: Germany's AfD receives millions in public funding
events.summary: The right-wing extremist party Alternative for Germany (AfD) profits significantly from public funding. Is democracy in Germany funding its own downfall?

events.title: How dangerous are Iranian secret services in Germany?
events.summary: Iranians in exile are being targeted by the regime's secret services, which is believed to be responsible for thousands of deaths since the start of the mass protests in Iran.

events.title: How European cinema is stealing Hollywood's spotlight
events.summary: As Hollywood doubles down on sequels, the contenders for the European Film Awards feature bold, political works that are challenging audiences and creating buzz far beyond the continent.

events.title: 2026 stargazing: Eclipses, meteor showers and supermoons
events.summary: 2026 will leave stargazers spoiled for sights in the sky, with four eclipse events, multiple meteor showers and several supermoons.

events.title: German firms hunker down as Trump marks one year in office
events.summary: One year into Donald Trump's second term, higher tariffs and sharper threats are straining transatlantic business. German companies in the US are weighing compliance against resistance as uncertainty grows.

events.title: Livestream: 4 award-winning filmmakers discuss risk-taking cinema
events.summary: DW co-hosts a talk with European Film Award and Oscar nominees Jafar Panahi, Oliver Laxe, Mascha Schilinski and Joachim Trier. Watch it live here.

events.title: NBA Europe to 'respect' European basketball tradition
events.summary: The NBA is pressing ahead with plans to launch a basketball league in Europe, with a slated launch date of 2027.

events.title: 'Charlie Hebdo' cartoon on Swiss fire tragedy sparks outrage
events.summary: A cartoon by the French satirical weekly portraying the deadly fire in Crans-Montana as the "comedy of the year" provokes disgust.

events.title: Women poised to take India sports to the next level
events.summary: India has been experiencing major growth in women's sports in recent years. This is being fuelled by investment from both the public and private sector – as well as many role models.

events.title: Wikipedia at 25: Of collective knowledge and its fault lines
events.summary: From utopian origins to AI-driven rivals, the "people's encyclopedia" has been shaped by debates over neutrality, expertise and the future of shared knowledge.

events.title: Louvre hikes ticket price for non-EU visitors by almost half
events.summary: The Louvre museum and several other French cultural sites are increasing the price of entry for visitors from outside Europe. So-called "dual pricing" is quite common in less wealthy countries but rare in richer regions.

events.title: International Space Station crew to make emergency return to Earth
events.summary: A medical emergency will force four astronauts aboard the International Space Station to return to Earth prematurely.

events.title: From the Monroe Doctrine to the Donroe Doctrine
events.summary: America for Americans: That was James Monroe's message to European colonial powers in 1823, to respect the independence of new nations of the Americas. Trump is reinterpreting this doctrine.

events.title: Kazakhstan oil output plunges as Ukraine's drones hit Russia
events.summary: Kyiv's attacks on Russian oil terminals and refineries may damage their enemy, but they are also having an impact on other economies such as Kazakhstan's and risk alienating allies.

events.title: Will Trump risk a clash with China over Iran tariff?
events.summary: Donald Trump's sudden 25% tariff on nations trading with Iran puts Beijing squarely in the spotlight. China knows how to evade sanctions and has the muscle to retaliate. DW explores what this showdown could mean.

events.title: Australians are changing their response to wildfires
events.summary: DW's Stuart Braun had a dangerously near miss during Australia's 2009 "Black Saturday" inferno. As this month's fires burned near his rural home, he wasn't taking any chances.

events.title: Australia: Writers' festival called off amid boycott
events.summary: The Adelaide Writers' Week retracted an invitation to an Australian-Palestinian author, citing the the Bondi Beach attack. Dozens, including the event's director and the former PM of New Zealand, withdrew in response.

events.title: Trump's feud with US Fed chair Powell rattles investors
events.summary: Trump's fight with Federal Reserve Chair Powell just took a new twist — sending stocks and the dollar lower and lifting gold. DW looks into whether a new criminal investigation could put the Fed's independence at risk.

events.title: Cannabis: Now you can measure how much is too much
events.summary: At what point does smoking weed get dangerous? A British study measured cannabis consumption in THC units and determined which amounts increase health risks. The system comes with clear risk thresholds ― and weaknesses.

events.title: AI concerns and slow growth put brakes on EU job market
events.summary: The pandemic gave workers increased options as home offices became the norm in some fields. Now, with the EU experiencing industrial slowdown and AI automation, workers are growing increasingly wary of switching jobs.

events.title: Cheating scandal hits Winter Olympics skeleton qualifier
events.summary: An international sports governing body is investigating after a Canadian coach was accused of manipulating an event — depriving racers of qualifying points ahead of February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: Why Venus Williams and other sports stars are playing longer
events.summary: More than three decades after she burst onto the tennis scene, Venus Williams is still playing at the top level. Why are we seeing elite athletes carrying on into their 40s and beyond?

events.title: 2026 World Cup: Germany to be based at North Carolina hotel
events.summary: Germany will be making a hotel in Winston-Salem their base camp during next summer's World Cup. The choice of headquarters has been seen as key to the national team's success — or failure — at previous World Cups.

events.title: From Guatemala to Panama: US affairs in Latin America
events.summary: The US attack on Venezuela is part of a long history of military interventions and political influence by the United States in Latin America. Here are five such examples since World War II.

events.title: Jack London felt 'Call of the Wild,' lived life of adventure
events.summary: The Klondike gold rush, wolves in the Alaskan snow, adventures on the high seas: Jack London, author of "The Call of the Wild" and "The Sea Wolf," was born 150 years ago. DW looks at his life.

events.title: As China sales slow, Germany's carmakers look to India
events.summary: For decades, German cars symbolized engineering perfection and economic power. Now, sales are down as China, a key market, goes electric. India could fill some of that gap for German carmakers. But will it be enough?

events.title: Greenland minister rejects US overtures to buy the territory
events.summary: As the United States increases its overtures and threats, Greenland's mining minister told DW that the territory needs to be treated as a partner, and said the people would decide the fate of their island's resources.

events.title: Epiphany blackface in Spain highlights racism in Europe
events.summary: People in Spain called attention to racism after a public official wore blackface at an Epiphany celebration. Countries such as the Netherlands have begun moving away from blackface traditions after efforts by activists.

events.title: The impact of US withdrawal from global climate pacts
events.summary: The US has pledged to pull out of dozens of international organizations and treaties established to advance the protection of the planet. But it doesn't spell the end of environmental action.

events.title: What to watch out for as the Bundesliga resumes play
events.summary: Bayern Munich seem to have another Bundesliga title all but sealed. But could a serious challenger still emerge? And who is in danger of relegation? DW has you covered.

events.title: China squeezes Japan on dual-use exports amid Taiwan spat
events.summary: Japan called new Chinese restrictions on dual-use exports for its military "absolutely unacceptable," while Beijing followed up with additional limits on dichlorosilane, a chemical used to make semiconductors.

events.title: Ski jumping: 'Are they trying to pull a fast one on us?'
events.summary: Domen Prevc has followed in his brother's footsteps by winning the Four Hills Tournament. However, more than the Slovenian's achievement, this year's edition may be remembered for less pleasant reasons.

events.title: How clean energy could save us trillions
events.summary: As clean energy prices fall, a fast transition to renewable energy is the cheapest option on the table. Experts say it could save us trillions in energy costs alone.

events.title: T20 World Cup cricket: Why Bangladesh won't travel to India
events.summary: A month before the tournament begins, Bangladesh have said they will not play T20 World Cup matches in India. The decision comes on the back of political and sporting tensions between the countries.

events.title: Can developing countries leapfrog fossil fuels?
events.summary: Rich nations built their wealth on coal, oil and gas. Now the world is asking poorer countries like Mozambique to chart a different course.

events.title: Ghanaian artist Ibrahim Mahama at top of the art world
events.summary: Best known for large-scale burlap sack installations, Ibrahim Mahama is helping shift power in the art world to the Global South while redefining art as a collective practice.

events.title: Accordion renews image as Germany's top instrument for 2026
events.summary: The accordion is gaining worldwide popularity. Germany has declared it the instrument of the year for 2026. This versatile music maker is used across various genres, from tango to heavy metal.

events.title: Why plastic bans aren't working and what needs to change
events.summary: Four years after Germany phased out light plastic bags, how has the EU addressed plastic waste? And why do single-use items still pile up in takeaway restaurants, shops and the environment?

events.title: Anthony Joshua discharged from hospital after Nigeria crash
events.summary: The British heavyweight sustained injuries in a car crash that killed two of his friends.

events.title: Women get drunk faster than men due to biology not tolerance
events.summary: At the same table, with the same drinks, women often get drunk faster than men — and alcohol can affect women's brains differently, making its effects stronger, sometimes more rewarding. But also more addictive.

events.title: Six ways the 2026 World Cup will be different
events.summary: The United States is set to host the 2026 World Cup, along with Canada and Mexico. DW fills you in on why this tournament will be different than its predecessors.

events.title: Greenland is "a strategic wake-up call for Europe" says France's Macron
events.summary: France, Denmark and Greenland's leaders addressed journalists in Paris on January 28, as Europe tries to reiterate its support to Greenland faced with threats of a US takeover. Emmanuel Macron confirmed that France supports the reinforcement of the defence position in the Arctic, ahead of a meeting with Mette Frederiksen and Jens-Frederik Nielsen.

events.title: 'Three million' pro-government protesters in Tehran? Fact-checking Iranian state media
events.summary: Pro-government demonstrations were held across Iran on January 12. In the capital, Tehran, Iranian state media reported that “three million” protesters took to the streets. But our analysis suggests these figures are significantly inflated.

events.title: Pooja Dhingra, the pastry chef who blends French craft with Indian flavours
events.summary: In this edition of Entre Nous we speak with Pooja Dhingra, founder of Le15 Patisserie in India. Pooja trained at the renowned Cordon Bleu school in Paris, before returning to India and becoming one of the country's most successful food entrepreneurs. She tells us about introducing India to French pastries, especially the popular macaron.

events.title: Replay: France's Macron, Denmark and Greenland leaders give joint press conference
events.summary: French President Emmanuel Macron said Wednesday a standoff with the United States over Greenland was "a strategic wake-up call for all of Europe", speaking alongside the prime ministers of Denmark and the Danish autonomous territory. Watch his joint press conference with Denmark's Mette Frederiksen and Jens-Frederik Nielsen of Greenland.

events.title: Around 300 people evacuated after fire at hotels in French Alps, officials say
events.summary: Around 300 people were evacuated from two hotels in the ski resort of Courchevel in the French Alps because of a fire, according to officials. No one was ‍injured in the blaze, which started around 7pm on Tuesday.

events.title: 'The dream of climbing Everest never left me': French mountaineer Orianne Aymard
events.summary: One of the few French women to climb Mount Everest has spoken to FRANCE 24 about her long-term dream to climb the world's highest mountain. Orianne Aymard made the climb despite several nasty accidents in earlier climbs, and she had a brain haemorrhage at the age of 25 that temporarily put the brakes on her life mission. Her exploits are celebrated in a new film and in two books that she herself has written, "L'appel de l'Everest" and "Au coeur de l'Everest". She spoke to us in Perspective.

events.title: Minneapolis: Democratis US Rep. Ilhan Omar sprayed by unknown substance during speech
events.summary: #US' Democratic congresswomen Ilhan Omar, frequently targeted by Donald #Trump, was interrupted Tuesday during a town hall meeting in #Minneapolis when a man threw liquid at her before being tackled to the ground. She was speaking about #ICE’s actions shaking the city.

events.title: 'Not just a police matter': Battling drug trade also 'sociopolitical', depends on schools & families
events.summary: Eve Irvine welcomes Professor Federico Varese, Criminologist and Professor at Oxford University. Cocaine trade and consumption in Europe is expanding and embedding itself ever more deeply into the social and geopolitical fabric of the continent. It's a complex ecosystem where increased production in Colombia, inventive trafficking routes through Africa, and technological innovations like drones and submersibles are pushing the limits of law enforcement. All the while, we are reminded that the war on drugs begins in the home and school.

events.title: With Greenland, Europe wants to show the US "there are red lines it must not cross"
events.summary: Emmanuel Macron wants to "reaffirm European solidarity and France's support for Denmark, Greenland, their sovereignty and their territorial integrity" as the French president welcomes Denmark and Greenland's leaders in Paris on January 28. Despite Donald Trump changed his attitude over a US takeover of Greenland, some are not convinced it will last. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle tells us more.

events.title: Watch live as Macron speaks to the press with heads of Denmark and Greenland
Doctors hunted down, bodies piled up: Iran in 'state of shock' after protests
events.summary: PRESS REVIEW – Wednesday, January 28, 2026: First, French papers debate the 2025 immigration statistics released by the interior ministry. Also, the Spanish government has said it will give legal status to half a million undocumented migrants. Elsewhere, the atmosphere in Iran is bleak, as Le Monde reports. Next, the United States pulls out of the Paris Agreement for the second time, just as the doomsday clock strikes 85 seconds to midnight. Finally, sales of gay hockey romance novel "Heated Rivalry" heat up.

events.title: Minnesota Democrat representative attacked despite Trump vowing to "de-escalate"
events.summary: As the White House worked to "de-escalate" tensions in Minneapolis on January 27, a man sprayed Minnesota Congresswoman Ilhan Omar with a syringe of unknown liquid at a town hall meeting, where she called for curbing the Trump administration's anti-immigration crackdown.

events.title: Lili Keller-Rosenberg, bearing witness to the end
events.summary:
At 93, Holocaust survivor Lili Keller-Rosenberg refuses to let history fade. Arrested at 11 and deported to Ravensbrück and Bergen-Belsen, she broke decades of silence to share her story.
 
Today, she speaks weekly in schools, passing her memory on to the “little messengers of peace.” FRANCE 24 met her in Lille
 
#HolocaustSurvivor #WWII #History #Ravensbrück #BergenBelsen

events.title: Macron hosts Danish and Greenlandic leaders in Paris
events.summary: Greenland's Jens-Frederik Nielsen and Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen are in ‍Paris to meet French President Emmanuel Macron. The goal is to shore up support over U.S. President Donald Trump's push to take over the Arctic island that has been Danish territory ​for centuries. FRANCE 24's James André tells us what to know in Paris.

events.title: Eighteen teams to play final Champions League group stage day
events.summary: On January 28, the final matchday of the Champions League group stage takes place, with all 18 matches being played simultaneously. At the final whistle, the 24 teams to qualify for the knock-out stages will be known. Three French clubs are in the running, while as many as five English clubs could be among the eight who advance straight to the round of 16.

events.title: Former French senator found guilty of drugging lawmaker to assault her
events.summary: A former French senator has been found guilty of spiking a lawmaker's drink, with the intent to sexually assault her. He has received a four year sentence, eighteen months of which are guaranteed to be served behind bars. Joël Guerriau says he plans to appeal the verdict, he claims the drugging was an accident. Since the incident, Sandrine Josso has become a campaigner against the crime dubbed "chemical submission".

events.title: Democrat Ilhan Omar sprayed by unknown substance during speech in Minneapolis
events.summary: A man sprayed an unknown substance on Democratic U.S. Representative Ilhan Omar and was tackled to the ground on january 27 during a town hall in Minneapolis, where tensions over federal immigration enforcement have come to a head after agents fatally shot an intensive care nurse and a mother of three this month. FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson tells us more about the current political climate in the country from Washington.

events.title: Iran International TV channel one of the only reliable sources for Iranians
events.summary: It deems itself to be the voice of truth for all Iranians. Iran International is a private Persian-language news channel based in London that has been declared a terrorist organisation by Tehran. Since its creation in 2017, it is one of the only reliable sources of information for Iranians can access via via satellite and private VPNs and is a prime target of Iranian authorities.

events.title: What's next for the Gaza ceasefire deal now that the last israeli hostage is back?
events.summary: With the last hostage, Ran Gvili, recovered from the Gaza Strip, a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas moves into an uncertain new phase. The truce deal that came into effect in October 2025 calls for the deployment of an international security force in the Palestinian territory, the further withdrawal of Israeli soldiers there, and the disarming of Hamas.

events.title: Landslide leaves Sicilian town teetering on cliff edge
events.summary: Roads have vanished and homes were left completely destroyed in ‍the Sicilian town of ​Niscemi after a landslide left it teetering on the edge of a cliff. More that 1,500 people have been forced to evacuate as the ground spilt over several kilometres after a storm hit.

events.title: Largest cocaine seizure in Portugal sheds light on use of narcosubmersibles
events.summary: After the discovery by Portuguese officials of nine tonnes of cocaine on board a submarine off the coast of the Azores, the focus has turned to submersibles and other customised crafts used by drug cartels to ship narcotics to Europe.

events.title: Local elections in Marseille: Left and far right in battle for city hall
events.summary: As France gears up for local elections in March, mayoral races are heating up across the country. In Marseille, France's second-largest city, which is grappling with a drug trafficking problem, security is at the heart of the election. Two candidates are currently neck-and-neck in the polls: the incumbent mayor Benoît Payan, representing various left-wing parties; and the far-right National Rally candidate Franck Allisio. Our France 2 colleagues report, with FRANCE 24's Lauren Bain.

events.title: ICE "not welcome" in Milan to assist with Winter Olympics security, says mayor
events.summary: Italians have expressed outrage at the inclusion of an ICE branch in ensuring security during Milan's Winter Olympics. Although the officers in question work on cross-border security and are separate from those on the forefront of Trump's immigration crackdown, the reaction highlights the widening rift between the US and its traditional allies. FRANCE 24's Seema Gupta tells us more from Rome.

events.title: Trump clashes with NRA gun lobby, growing Republican "unease" prior to midterms
events.summary: Prominent Republicans and gun rights advocates helped elicit a White House turnabout this week after bristling over the administration’s characterization of Alex Pretti as responsible for his own death because he lawfully possessed a weapon when he was shot at in Minneapolis. Homeland security chief Kristi Noem is also finding herself at the centre of the controversy. FRANCE 24's Kethevane Gorjestani tells us what's going on behind the scene.

events.title: Starmer in China: What will be on the table?
events.summary: It doesn't feel all that long ago that David Cameron took the Chinese leader Xi Jinping for a pint in a Buckinghamshire pub.

events.title: ICE victim wasn't a 'would-be assassin', Trump says
events.summary: Donald Trump has appeared to distance himself from controversial remarks by senior members of his administration about ICE shooting victim Alex Pretti.

events.title: Senior politician dies in India plane crash
events.summary: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has paid tribute after a minister was killed in a plane crash which left no survivors.

events.title: Regime crackdown: Life inside Iran
events.summary: 👉Listen to The World with Richard Engel and Yalda Hakim on your podcast app👈

events.title: Amazon to cut 16,000 jobs globally
events.summary: Amazon has told staff it plans to cut around 16,000 jobs globally as part of efforts to streamline operations and reduce bureaucracy across the business.

events.title: 'Talk to me, Goose': Starmer teases Macron with Top Gun mock up
events.summary: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has poked fun at his French counterpart - by putting on a pair of sunglasses at an event before saying, "bonjour".

events.title: South Korea's former first lady jailed for 20 months for corruption
events.summary: The wife of South Korea's former president Yoon Suk Yeol - who was ousted over a martial law bid - has been jailed for 20 months for corruption.

events.title: ICE agents to have role at Winter Olympics - but told they are 'not welcome'
events.summary: ICE agents will have a security role at the Winter Olympics in Italy, it has been revealed, after the man who led the Trump administration's crackdown in Minneapolis was moved out of the city.

events.title: Doomsday Clock moved closer to midnight than ever: What is it and how does it work?
events.summary: The Doomsday Clock has been moved closer than ever to midnight by scientists, a change that is said to signify that we are edging closer to the end of the world.

events.title: Coco Gauff condemns tennis's lack of privacy after she's caught on camera smashing racket
events.summary: Coco Gauff has called for more privacy for tennis players after being caught on camera smashing her racket in an off-court players' area following her Australian Open quarter-final loss to Elina Svitolina on Tuesday.

events.title: Al-Maliki is defiant after Trump threatens to withdraw US support for Iraq
events.summary: Former Iraqi Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki has expressed defiance after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened to withdraw support for Iraq if he returns to power

events.title: Sarah Mullally confirmed as archbishop of Canterbury, first woman to lead the church
events.summary: Sarah Mullally was confirmed as archbishop of Canterbury on Wednesday, becoming the first woman to lead the Church of England

events.title: Report warns that combined casualties in Russia's war on Ukraine could hit 2 million
events.summary: A new report warns that the number of soldiers killed, injured or missing in Russia's war in Ukraine could reach 2 million by spring

events.title: Huge landslide cleaves off the edge of a town in Sicily
events.summary: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni has toured a southern Sicilian town where days of heavy rains triggered a massive landslide that cleaved off the town's edge

events.title: Dutch court to rule on climate change case brought by Caribbean islanders
events.summary: A court is ruling Wednesday on a case brought by eight residents of a Caribbean island against the Dutch government for not protecting them from climate change

events.title: Lawmakers in German state elect new governor to counter far-right rise
events.summary: Lawmakers in an eastern German state have elected a new governor as mainstream parties try to prevent a victory for the far-right Alternative for Germany in a regional election that is only seven months away

events.title: ASEAN's top diplomats under pressure to end Myanmar war and finalize South China Sea pact
events.summary: Southeast Asia’s top diplomats are holding their first major meeting in the central Philippine city of Cebu under growing pressure to beat a deadline to conclude talks on a nonaggression pact with China this year and push a peace plan that has so far f...
